Reviews.Title: “September 2011”
Reviews.Author: poolman5960
Reviews.Content: Was a very nice, clean hotel and had a great morning breakfast that was furnished with the room. Had agood little restaurant just about anything that you would want, A little light on availability of attractions close to the hotel but did have a shuttle that went into the center of Rome twice a day. Didn't remember before we went that there would be a $ Euro charge each day to use the internet...

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Class Hotel outside city center”
Reviews.Author: FrankDLaw
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days after our Mediterranean and Adriatic cruise. The hotel is modern, clean and fairly tastefully furnished. Although we rented a car, we chose to drive the car until just outside the city center where parking is easier and free and then catch a bus into Centro. The only downside to this hotel is the fact that it is located outside Rome in the outskirts. There is a Carrefour Hypermarket nearby but apart from that it is a pretty remote place. However, a half hour bus ride into Centro is worth it when you compare apple for apple with the postage stamp sized rooms that you'd get for the same price from hotels in the center of Rome!. The rooms are fine and we found the toilets fairly well appointed with good toiletries supplied. The king sized bed was comfortable. Internet was available downstairs and although fairly well patronized, we did not have to wait for an inordinate amount of time before we could use them. The room safe's instructions were in Italian, so that was a bummer! However, we would stay here again as the hotel was reasonably comfortable, safe and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business trip, but also for tourism”
Reviews.Author: Visitantewr
Reviews.Content: It is very good hotel for a business trip. However it is located far far away. If you are going to Rome for pleasure, you have to remember that it is not a city center. Fortunately there is shuttle bus and it is easy to get into the city center. Very good food, very nice and comfortable room, good price. If you like business hotels and a little bit luxury, you can get it on really low price (but far away from the city center, in industrial area).

Reviews.Title: “Better as a kickoff point than for touring Rome”
Reviews.Author: BeachSeekerNewMexico
Reviews.Content: This was a nice big hotel that wasn't near anything. It is billed as a conference center, and it is probably well suited for that because it has several large dining areas and seems built to handle large groups, although it wasn't staffed for large groups when I was there. The rooms are modern, clean and comfortable if you like hard mattresses. Our group spent 4 nights there at the start of our tour and the last night before we left, and the only real complaint from anyone was the remote location. The meals in the evening were good, but not outstanding. Our breakfast was a buffet in a different serving area and had a large variety from cereal, pastry and fresh fruit to eggs and sausage and bacon. They had 2 modern coffee machines and 2 juice machines where you press buttons for your choice of beverage but every morning one or the other wasn't working, so you couldn't depend on getting that red orange juice or a hot chocolate. For those who must be "connected", there was WiFi and 2 computers by the elevator that were free for the using on a first come, first served basis. I had no problem checking the weather and news every day, but others in the group reported outages in both wired and wireless access. Our group boarded a bus every morning and went touring in Rome, so we spent too much time in the horrible traffic, especially on the October morning the flash flood hit Rome and turned our 30 minute ride into a two hour trip. If your primary purpose is touring Rome, choose another hotel! You'll pay more, but it is worth it in the long run. If you want a kickoff point to go North, East or South, this is your place. It sits near the loop around Rome and has quick access to the autostrade.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_G0rge0us
Reviews.Content: Nothing bad to say to be honest, we only had a room while me and my best friend visited Rome for 3 days to do my wedding shopping. Very modern nice and clean. The only one thing is that its outside the centre so we had to take a local bus to get to the city centre Hotel also offers bus but for a charge. Been there in April 2007

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Worldtoddler
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 days. Very, very, very far away from the centre. Food is terrible. Rooms are definitely for not they had been priced for. My friend was supposed to stay there , maybe it's good she didn't . Although she had lost 260e because they don't reply on calls or emails. They charge booking rate straight away from your credit card despite booking company presenting the opposite. Moneygrabbers. Nothing else

Reviews.Title: “in the middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: tolleyo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and comfortable...the problem is that it cost 45 Euros to get from the train station to the hotel - and that's after we talked them down from 607 Euros. The reason is because the hotel is in the middle of nowhere - not close to anything! When you drive up to it you feel like you are in the industrial section of Rome. However - the staff at the hotel is awesome!!! - They speak English very well and will go out of their way to help you. The breakfast buffet was great too - lots of selections

Reviews.Title: “absolute joke”
Reviews.Author: Elliot G
Reviews.Content: although decorated cleanly this hotel is soulless. much further outside the city center than described, in which if you do not drive or book a cab (which will cost you around 25-30 euro's each way) you can get a bus and then a metro, so your looking at 30-40 minutes into rome, not what you need on a short weeekend break! also the unfriendly staff member told us the wrong side of the road to catch the bus from...which will take you out into rural italy and leave a bad taste in your mouth. oh and i haven't mentioned that the hotel is located opposite a prison! and if you are planning on coming back at night to this place then you'll have to avoid the prostitute's littering the street out front, where there were several used condoms on the floor. the bed is stiff as hell and most of the lights were not working, at least the shower worked, anyway i didn't stay a second night, i left because regardless of having paid for the trip i was so relieved to get out of there. i'm sure its great if your a tasteless businessman who needs some paid for company while away. my advice is steer clear...regardless of getting a cheaper deal through lastminute.com or other sites such and alike. pay more and be in center Roma and be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, bad location”
Reviews.Author: Myself00
Reviews.Content: the hotel isnt bad, very clean, good rooms and what not, but the staff were not so great, specially the fat blonde lady who worked in the restaurant, never tipped her because of that. anyway the problem with this hotel is the location, the location is horrible and far away from the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap for a four star, but in the middle of no man’s land!”
Reviews.Author: Smarty18
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very far from anything other than industrial factories and strange slot machine casinos. We booked this hotel for just 40euros a night so we weren’t too fussed. It was well air-conditioned, which is a bonus when combating the Roman heat. It took one metro line and a bus to get there from Roma Termini, both only costing 1euro each, which was very good. You have to be sure to get on the right bus though, as we did initially head off in the wrong direction. The hotel offers a free shuttle service, but it only leaves from the nearest metro station at 10pm heading back to the hotel, and at 10am & 12pm heading out to the metro station. So it’s good if you’re arriving late or have spent the day in the city, but you do need to book it. Our room was good; we had a mini-bar, which we simply used to cool our own cheaper supermarket drinks. There is a casino-come-café about 500m down the road (not a pedestrian-friendly walk however!) There’s also a great little local restaurant further down over a bridge, more like 1km away. It was worth it though, as they did a pretty good spaghetti, and for a fraction of the cost of the hotel’s overpriced restaurant. We would recommend this hotel to those on conference or those wanting a 40euro a night hotel in Rome and don’t mind the travel. It is very far out, but it’s cheap transport in Rome, and if you do your homework it’s not that bad. 40euros a night is hard to beat and you have to take the good with the bad. Wifi is only free in the lobby and there is literally nothing to do out in the area. Pity the hotel didn’t have a pool and a more economical option for dining.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, good breakfast, not so great location(but not too bad)”
Reviews.Author: jandelin311
Reviews.Content: Ok, I know this is old news, but my wife and I stayed here about five years ago on our honeymoon for a few days. The hotel is very beautiful overall, and had an upscale feel to it. Other than checking in, I didn't have to deal with the staff. So, in my opinion, the staff were decent. The breakfast had a lot of options of food. The rooms were large and very clean even though you'll neve find a hotel in all of europe without the sweaty european smell even in freshly washed towells. I have no idea why. Anyway, everything about the hotel is good, except for the location. They have free shuttles that leave from the hotel every hour or so to take people into Rome. It really isn't too bad if you time the shuttles properly. We were able to see everything we wanted to and reach the last shuttle leaving back from Rome to the hotel every night. I would say, if you've got more than a couple of days in Rome, stay here because the rooms aren't priced bad at all. If you're on a time crunch and need to see the city in a day or two, then maybe look for a closer hotel. But, seriously, it really wasn't too bad taking the shuttle in and out of the city.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: kougis
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel. Perfect breakfast. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Bad location,nice room”
Reviews.Author: Zhenlipong
Reviews.Content: Before we going we did read about the reviews because we opted for the secret room on lastminute.com and it came out with this hotel. Anyway what I want to tell here is do not try this hotel unless you don't mind staying in a middle of nowhere,and to be served by rude and miserable front counter staffs (except one with glasses on)!!The rest are not well trained to work in the hospitality industry at all!!even they do have a shuttle bus to go to the Ponte Mammolo metro station,but the seat and time is very limited so my advice is best book it early as you can. Also, do not expect there is a bath tub in the standard room as described on the website. The overall staying in the hotel was ok if you are ready to receive an unfriendly service and bad location hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but miles from anywhere”
Reviews.Author: griffin867
Reviews.Content: Only book if you have hired a car. Hotel is a 25 Euro taxi ride fron Colosseum and +50 Euro from FCO airport. Prenestina is not a very nice area at all. Buses are regular (508 to Ponte Mammalmo) and a 20 min Metro ride into center of Rome. Remember Rome is Filthy and full off hawkers trying to sell you rubbish and tour guides trying to get you on a tour. Walked 50 feet at the vatican and was asked about 20 times!! very annoying

Reviews.Title: “Decent corporate style hotel BUT miles from the centre of Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: zetec16v
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife to celebrate my birthday. The hotel is smart and functional but lacks any soul. Its definitely a business hotel and is situated miles from the centre of Rome. You'll need a car to stay here. Breakfast was average.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price - Really bad location”
Reviews.Author: barbados00503
Reviews.Content: It is as easy as this. If you have a (rental) car and don´t mind the time driving into the city, stay there. If you are "on foot" don´t get tempted booking the nice price, stay in the city! The rooms are nice but also be aware of staying on the top floor. We stayed in room 608 and had a constant background noice from probably the airconditioning units.

Reviews.Title: “Think Again - what a dump and miles from anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: Mikeboy1
Reviews.Content: Think again if you are thinking of booking this hotel. It is a good 20km out of town and requires a walk, a bus and a metro to get to the Termini! An hour at least if all transport is on time. Our room was filthy, dark and spartan. The staff did their best to ignore you and spoke among themselves in their native language when you asked them something or tried to complain. We were booked into a different Eurostars Hotel which was overbooked and they dumped us out here. If you are prepared to put up with the rudeness and have the time to spend a couple of hours extra a day getting into and out of town only then book this hotel if they are giving away rooms for free. And even then think again. Avoid this company completely!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a bad joke”
Reviews.Author: GPeto
Reviews.Content: Saying that his hotel is in Rome is like calling Gerona airport Barcelona. Its well outside of the city in the middle of nowhere. Its a fairly large hotel with fairly normal rooms. I dont see any reason why somebody would want to be here deliberately. This hotel is max a 3star and not 4star as they call themselves ....and i payed 300EUR for a room.....sadly every hotel was fully booked in Rome. I hope I never have to come back here again

Reviews.Title: “Value for money but with some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: 1jodelman1
Reviews.Content: Quite a way out of town but not difficult to get to once you have found it the first time! Metro B from Rome's Temini to Ponte Mammolo then 508 bus (from lower bus park- don't go looking for it on the upper bus park - can be confusing). Ask driver for Eurostars Hotel. After getting off walk 100 metres in same direction as bus - alongside the road as there is no pavement and then turn right at large sign "Eurostars Hotel". Drive seems you are entering a construction site but keep going and the hotel is on the right maybe 100 m.Hotel is cheaply built but modern design. Certainly not 4 star even by Italian standardbut staff friendly and helpful. Free broadband both in rooms and in lobby. Didn't use restaurants. Elevators to higher rooms for some reason have been downgraded to 3 persons only and one was intermittent when we were there. Still some building work going on but no disturbance as it is in the grounds and not in the hotel. Downside is that Hotel offered huttle into Rome centre but this has been changed without notice to local metro station at €4 and only 1000, 12000 and return at 2200. Better to get 3 day Roma Pass with all the perks as well as free travel buses, metro and trains etc plus 2 free entrances and 30% of the rest at the historical sights except Vatican. Overall hotel good value for the money but be prepared for a hike into town. Once you know the way it is really easy. If you want a clean, well air conditioned hotel at low cost in Rome then you should consider this.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good quality hotel but a long way and a pain to get to”
Reviews.Author: lincsblonde
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried about having booked this hotel on the basis of some awful reviews on this site but I was very pleasantly suprised. It's fantastic value, it allowed us to spend 4 nights there as oppose to 1 or 2 closer in and it's a really nice hotel. Rooms are very clean, comfortable, quiet and dark at night, a good night's sleep is on the cards after lots of sight seeing. We found the staff really friendly and helpful. There is a bar and restaurant although we didn't see much activity at breakfast time and went into Rome to eat. The down side is that it's a long way out. Using a taxi would defeat the object of saving money on the hotel and so the only realistic option is public transport. It's cheap and easy when you know how and here's how. Buy a metro / bus ticket for 3 days or a week depending on length of stay, it's cheap and makes life a lot easier as you only validate on first use. Get on the metro B line, direction Rebibbia, and get off at Ponte Mammolo. Go out the metro station and you will see the bus terminal, you need the 508. They should run every 20 minutes but there doesn't appear to be a time table. Get onto the right hand side of the bus and near an exit if it's crowded. It's 20 - 25 minutes and so you have room to manoeuvre if it's busy. Watch out for a 'Penny Market', then the turning (not advertising sign) to 'Decathalon' and then Hotel Bright, at this point ring the bell and get off at the next stop. Walk on for 5 minutes in the direction of the bus (there's no footpath) and you'll come to the hotel's drive on the right. If you miss the stop you can get off at the next one and walk back but it's further. To get into Rome reverse the journey. Out of the hotel's drive, walk left along the road, cross to bus stop. Take 508 to the Ponte Mammolo terminal. Switch to the metro B line. For Colosseum stay on the B line to Colosseo. For Vatican Museums, Spanish Steps, etc you'll need to switch to A line at Termini. Obviously from the above the hotel is suitable for adults only who are fit enough to walk and cope with crowded public transport. Enjoy your stay, we did.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lilisierra
Reviews.Content: If you are planning to book in this hotel, you better think twice!!!! Its location is really awfull!!! Yo take about half an hour to get to the city center!! The staff is really rude and if you ask for help at night you can find the receptionist and other staff members sleepong at the hotel lobby!! also, twice my room was opened while I was inside the room!!! In only 2 days!!!! I would never recomend this hotel... Awful service, location and staff members!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: popeyes035
Reviews.Content: - If you are a tourist, you can not go to Roma less than about one hour. - Some rooms are looking to the reception, - Rooms are not cleanless - I couldnt find any breakfast at the hotel. no tea, no coffee, no bread, you can eat just cornflakes. - I thing the hotels stuff are not known,how can they smile. - There is no cafe, no reustorant near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from the city but otherwise a great deal”
Reviews.Author: kmf54
Reviews.Content: Good place, clean facilities, comfortable room. The problem is that this place is far from the city and not on any super convenient public transportation lines. Need to take a bus and then a subway to the city. But if you're willing to do that it's honestly not a bad place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain at all”
Reviews.Author: Slash76
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not the easiest way to visit Rome but is do-able, the female reception staff were very friendly and helpful, but the housekeepers are as lazy as you can get, they never cleaned our room and tried to claim we put a do not disturb sign on the door, presumably they work on a finish & go method. The restaurant is very pricey but there is a great restaurant around the corner. Would go again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Poor Poor Location!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel316
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice for the price, the only reason I give it a poor rating is due to it's location. If you are spending the money to travel to Italy, do yourself a favor and spend the extra money to stay somewhere centrally located. This hotel is 20 mins from the city, if I would have known this prior to booking, I would not have stayed there. They have a shuttle that takes you to and from the city for $3 each way, however the last shuttle leaves the city at approx 9pm, which means you have to stop whatever you are doing around 8 to make your way to the pick up location. There is so much to see in Rome at night, I really regret not having seen it. Taxi from the city to the hotel would run you $60-$80. If you are a morning person and never stay anywhere past 8 pm, then this is a good hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible location”
Reviews.Author: Awal10
Reviews.Content: Eurostar is a pretty decent big impersonal business-type hotel with standard rooms and ammenities. There is free internet access and TV in rooms. Staff is quite helpful. Breakfast is nothing special, but it is not bad either. Just average. The hotel would be OK if not for its location - it is literally in the middle of nowhere at the outskirts of Rome. To go to the center by public transport you need to first take the bus and then the subway. The journey will take about 30 minutes, depending on the traffic. An alternative is to use the hotel shuttle, but it is quite expensive and it only goes twice in the morning to the center and comes back twice in the evening. Also it is usually full, so you need to book in advance.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: joanna102
Reviews.Content: After we managed to find and book a stylish hotel for a reasonable price in the historic center for our end-of-the-year trip to Rome we were indeed quite proud of ourselves. At least until on a Christmas Eve our booking agent called us to inform that our hotel was overbooked and that we actually have no other choice but to accept the Eurostars Congress. Well, we did... Eurostars is a typical business-oriented hotel, with average rooms and service and reasonable prices. But it is really in the middle of nowhere, overlooking some industrial sites on the one side and some rural areas on the other. It takes about 40 minutes to go to the city center if you use public transport (first bus, then subway) or 20 minutes if you go for a hotel shuttle, which is a bit overpriced. It did not bother us that much since anyway we were leaving the hotel early in the morning and coming back late in the evening after the whole day sightseeing, but otherwise the location is inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, poor location, unhelpful staff, lovely room.”
Reviews.Author: AmyC17
Reviews.Content: I was very worried about this hotel after i booked up and later read the reviews. I have to say that it wasn't as some of the reviews and i suppose it depends on the purpose of your trip. The hotel is in the middle of nowhere but you can get the shuttle to a local underground, where you have to find your own way into the city. The shuttle only leaves three times a day, 10:00, 12:00 and 22:00. But we were happy to stay out all day from 12-10pm to see all the sights. When asking the staff how to get into the city they were very unhelpful. There was always a queue at the reception and they were in no hurry to serve you. They answered the telephone when you were in the middle of talking to them. They also did not care if you were waiting in a queue and other people pushed to the front, they would just serve them first. It was cheap enough to stay there, although by the time you add on the price of taxis's, the shutle bus and underground passses etc then is it really!? You have to be confident to get around on your own, following the complex underground system etc. The room had no complimentary tea/coffee which you find in simple travel inns etc. The t.v. had no english channels, they were all Italian. But, again it depends if you are wanting to watch the t.v. The hotel did take advantage of the fact it is in the middle of nowhere. You have to pay for tea/coffee, drinks etc, no local shops. The hotel restaurant was lovely but quite expensive (4 euro for a coca cola). Ending on a positive, the rooms were very spacious and clean. The daily upkeep of the room was excellent. Afterall, different people expect different services for their money, this is just my opinion of my personal experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good one”
Reviews.Author: PreethamV
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good and also the service was at its best.

Reviews.Title: “ok if you are travelling on a budget”
Reviews.Author: parkstreeter
Reviews.Content: If you want to have a hotel in the centre of rome then this is not the hotel for you. The hotel is about 30-40 minutes away from the centre. I went to Rome for a 5 day holiday with my brother. Although the hotel is quite far away. it was clean and the service was good and suited us as we were on a budget. If you dont mind a bit of travelling on italian transport then this hotel is fine. For those of you who do decided to stay here then here is a few tips. buy a metro ticket for 16 euros it will enable unlimited travel for one week. when you come out of the hotel entrance cross the road and go to your right and you will see a bus stop. The 508 bus runs every 20 minutes. the bus will take you into ponte mammolo which is the nearest metro station and it easy from there. the last bus leaves at 0020 hours and look for hotel bright as this is your get off spot for the hotel(5minutes further down the road is Eurostar roma congress). Dont be concerned about not speaking italian, i dont and we managed the transport easily. if you have small children then this hotel is not for you unless you have a car as the hotel is along a very busy road and the italians have no idea of raod safety. all in all i had a fab holiday and hope someone finds my travel tips handy.

Reviews.Title: “Location was lousy, food was awful, and money was stolen from the safe”
Reviews.Author: Jana92
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Rome. I would have liked to have stayed closer to the city. The food at this hotel was so disappointing. Dinners were overcooked and breakfast was undercooked. Also money was stolen from the safe where our collections were stored. What an awful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid.”
Reviews.Author: CMGEG
Reviews.Content: We had a considerable amount of money stolen from our locked safe while we were on tour. Obviously an 'inside' job as they only took some not all of the money. Probably figured no one counts their money ~ we did so we knew. Management attempted to prevent us from filing a police report. Glad we took the time out of our trip to report it to the police.

Reviews.Title: “Money STOLEN from LOCKED SAFE!”
Reviews.Author: STEPH-CT
Reviews.Content: CAUTION!!!! THEY ARE THEIVES THERE !!!!!! I would think twice before staying at this hotel..... My group tour of 54 people, a Christian Pilgramage from CT. USA, HAD MONEY STOLEN from our PREIST from a LOCKED SAFE in the hotel !!!! The hotel, Eurostar Roma Congress.... Management tried to deter us from reporting it to the police, and after requesting, or demanding a copy of the "room activity" based upon entry/exit registered from key cards, claimed they were unable to determine who had entered the room although card number "19" which was assigned to a staff member was on the log sheet.... tHEY STOLE CLOSE TO A THOUSAND DOLLARS !!!! Due to the lack of concern of the Hotel, reluctance and actual trying to deter us from reporting it, I can only think the Management and Hotel security are in on this together.... Please think twice about staying here... Along with the above mentioned...I found the staff for the dining room under staffed. They served the same side vegetables and deserts the exact same every night for 4 days to us...

Reviews.Title: “They robbed us 100 Euros from the safe”
Reviews.Author: andreunz
Reviews.Content: Couple of times we left outiside the door the "do not disturb sign" and each time room service entered the room, without our authorisation Before leaving we found out that 100 €uros was missing from the safe and apparently couple of people from the hotel knew the combination. We reported the fraud to the police and gave a copy to the hotel which told us they would be back after the insurance answered. As per today (October 2009 ) and after 6 months of total silence none from the hotel replies either to our phone calls (the receptionist calls a non exhistent director) neither to our e-mails. Watch out, especially if you are foreigners, those are the people the insiders are looking for!!! NEVER ANYMORE!!!

Reviews.Title: “I liked it”
Reviews.Author: HisFussiness
Reviews.Content: My decision to stay here was price driven - I think it was 49 Euros. Yes, a desolate location off a very uninspiring road out of Rome but you're safe locked behind the big steel gates at night. The room was very good, spacious, and the staff friendly enough. I didn't eat there so can't comment on the breakfast. Clearly not the place to stay for exploring the centre of Rome but being in a car the location is very handy for the ring road and getting out of the city, and for a late-night drive around the city centre. I'm going back later this year and would recommend it as a good value place to stay for the not so location-conscious.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient business hotel on the outskirts of Rome”
Reviews.Author: PurdeyHJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the outskirts of Rome on the eastern side. So, if you want to be in central Rome this is not the hotel for you - it takes at least 30 minutes to get into the city. The rooms are spacious, in good condition and pleasantly decorated. Make sure that you request a room on the outside of the building because the rooms which face inside are dark. The beds are convex so not particularly comfortable to sleep on. The breakfast buffet has a good selection of food however the coffee machine makes a terrible coffee and the fruit juices are watered down and are not at all fresh. The hotel's bar and restaurant food leaves a lot to be desired. The pizzas were truly awful - basically an over-cooked piece of cardboard. There is no decent restaurants in the area - you have to go into Rome for good food. It's also a shame that for such a spacious hotel, they haven't found space for a gym or a pool. I think business people would appreciate this kind of provision.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you are in the area......”
Reviews.Author: berkshire_nomads
Reviews.Content: I stay here regularly as we have an office nearby which I visit frequently. This hotel is fine in that context. It's 10 minutes to the office rather than 40 if I stay in the town centre, and the room costs less than a third of what you'd pay centrally. On the plus side the restaurant is quite good for dinner, and internet access is paid for by usage so much more economical than when you pay for say 24 or 48 hours. On the downside, the rooms are a bit tatty, though fairly large, and breakfast is pretty dire. The main thing i would point out is that the lower price reflects the location. The hotel is a good 40 minutes from the centre, even without too much traffic, and there is nothing in the vicinity. It really isn't the kind of area where you would want to go out for a stroll, and you have no sense of being in Rome at all. The main clientele of the hotel seems to be coach parties who will have transfers arranged to the sights and presumably get a good deal from not staying in the centre. That makes a lot of sense as on the whole its fine, however I would strongly recommned independent leisure travellers to book somewhere more central.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting”
Reviews.Author: JML0810
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not near Rome, it is about an hour away from the center. So, it is not good for tourists. However, the hotel does offer a shuttle bus to and from the main train station within Rome (Roma Termini), it does cost about 10.00 I believe however, each time you ride the bus to and from downtown. You can however ride the city buses and subway and reach the hotel for about $3.00 each way if you know how to naviagate Rome and the Italian way of public transportation (would not recommend this for non-experienced Italian travelers or those who do not know the language of Italian). The subways are VERY crowded in Rome however, if you know where you are going and are street smart you should have no troubles. Also, do not be dumb and make sure you keep your money/ valuables safe with you. Anyways, the hotel has very little service staff for the restaurant. The price is good but remember how much you have to spend to get to and from Rome on a daily basis, breakfast is also NOT included in the price of the hotel room unless noted. The hotel is not "kept up" very well and is confusing to get around in. The restuarant attached to the hotel is super exspensive and the food did not look that appealing. You are better off going to the nearby Carrefour (name of supermarket chain) down the street to get food and drinks for a 1/4 the cost. Bottom line: don't stay here unless you HAVE TO, there are better hotels out there for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Was bot impressed at all”
Reviews.Author: culturevulture28
Reviews.Content: After deciding on going to Rome to see in the new year me and my partner booked a 4 day break on last minute .com. We booked a 'top secret hotel' break with them, although we knew we wouldnt know the actual hotel until booking we were assured it was 4star and of very good quality in whats known as the 'business district' of rome with good connections to and from the city. Seeing as this was the case and we were still paying a fair bit for it we went ahead and set off the next day. On arriving at flumicino airport we asked tourist information on how to go about getting a taxi as it was late. We were told a taxi would be in excess of 75euros!! so we took the train instead to Tiburtini which took 45 mins, then the metro to ponte mammalo anf then a bus to via prenestina where the hotel is located. All in all it took about an hour and a half to reach a road scattered with milatary bases and car dealerships in the middle of which seemed like nowhere. The staff were surly and rather unhelpful and just handed us our keycard to our room. The room its self was spacious, though ive seen nicer premier/travel inns to be fair and the bathroom, though clean and modern only had a shower, which disapointed as all i wanted was a nice hot soak after the journey. We were told the hotel had cable and pay TV ...there were no english channels at all ( no BBC prime or anything ) which i wouldnt have minded as i dont go away to watch TV in hotels, but as we were restricted on being back by about 10 at night as the only transport would have been a hefty taxi cost, it would have been nice. Turned out there was no 'pay TV' either and then we later found out the internet in the room didnt work. After complaining about the internet twice and a technician coming up to fix it with no success, we were simply refunded and told that was that ( deal with it basically ) The staff couldnt have given a monkeys and seemed quite put out when we asked anything of them. After seeing the cost of the restaurant in the hotel we asked where the nearest bar/pizzeria was. We ended walking 15mins up some busy road with no pavements and constant traffic, with what looked like prostitutes hanging about to get to. There was a major supermarket 'carrefour' 15 mins in the other direction which we ended up buying food and wine from and simply emptied the mini bar to keep our goods chilled as the food at the hotel is overpriced and when ordering room service it turns up cold. Getting to Rome every day was a chore taking just over an hour though the transport in Rome is fantastically cheap. Im glad i went to Rome as the city is stunning but i was so saddened that this part of my romantic getaway was spoilt. I wouldnt recommend this sedate unfriendly hotel to anyone....and if you want to be within reach of anywhere forget it....the views from the hotel are horrid and the location is just completely dire. Definately one of the worst hotels ive stayed in...and to call itself 4star is a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Allrightythen
Reviews.Content: The service here sucks!! There was 4 people working at the front but they could only serve one at a time. The other 3 ppl would just ignore you. The breakfast was 12 euro if you didn't pay for it ahead of time on the internet.... The eggs were horrible and the rest was just dry bread and buns etc. The only good thing on there was the bacon, but 12 bucks for a plate of bacon is too much. The heat wasn't on in the hotel when we got there so the first night I had to sleep fully clothed with a hoody on to stay warm. Needless to say we only stayed there until our friend arrived and got the hell out of there. It's way to far from anything cool anyways, it was super easy to find a hotel right downtown close to everything and way cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “Too far out!!”
Reviews.Author: Beccalovesbags
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel from last minute.com on the secret hotel page, it sounded too good to be true..and it was. Once we got to Termini station we were told (after an hour of trying to find help) the hotel is miles out, cost 25 euros+ every time u want to come into rome, so we got to hotel, staff were very unfriendly and unhelpful. hotel restaurant was closed, it was a half hour walk to nearest restaurant (mcpatches) which was terrible, and there was no room service available. The next mornin we realised just how far out we were, u have to get a bus (the 508) from outside a building which looks like a jail, then once u reach ponte mammalo u get the tube to termini, this takes about an hour in total. on a night time u have to be back at ponte mammalo for 11 otherwise u have to get another taxi! and they charge from wherver they r, so cud be 15 euros b4 they have even reached the hotel, much to my disgust. room (once we got upgraded to a suite was lovely) as our sink broke, this was after a day of complaining tho...did i forget to mention that there are a few undesirables loitering around the road to the hotel (prostitutes). if u are a 1st time couple going to rome then don't book this hotel, its just ruins the holiday. stay as near to via nacionale/via repubblica/via condotti as possible. The staff really do disregard u aswell and make no effort to point u in the right direction at all. rubbish. probably good if ur there for business, but we were there for sightseein and for a romantic break - and just ended up in a bad mood most of the time. guttted.

Reviews.Title: “Mr Hotel reviews this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BasilFawltyTheWorld
Reviews.Content: Arrived with parents in tow and luckily checked in before a 60 seater coach of impatient Americans. The hotel reception run by two friendly girls was under severe pressure trying to book lots of guests in and simultaneously answer the continual ringing phones. (More staff needed at reception). The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. Satellite TV was disappointing if you are English! Evening meal choice at the bar or restaurant, we chose the bar which again was understaffed. The single barman/waiter got most of the order correct but did not charge for the wrong items. Good nights sleep. Breakfast was either 4 Euros for a croissant and coffee or 12 Euros for fruit and rolls and similar, boiled egg and the like. We paid the 12 Euros and again I was not impressed! The staff were surly and not particularly interested. (Do these people choose hotel work? Perhaps it is the only work they can find. We are spoiled in the U.K by Eastern Europeans who seem genuinely interested. Put off the rolls by the cockroach I spotted climbing out of the bread basket, wife's scrambled eggs were cold- staff indifferent! Check out was another adventure, more staff needed!! Apart from that- enjoyable stay, role on the Astura Palace Hotel in Nettuno. Standby for next report..........

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed experience”
Reviews.Author: freewalker
Reviews.Content: This was a disappointed experience and I would not recommend this so-called "4 star" hotel to others. I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. My basin in my bathroom was broken but I have called the reception for the night and no one attended to fix the problem. The receptionists were quite rude too !!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: tuhin2
Reviews.Content: The worst located hotel I have ever stayed in, it nearly ruined my holiday. I used taxi's for the first two days however they are expensive, aprox £18 to to town and further £18 back. In the end we bought a weekly metro / bus ticket allowing us to hop on hop off all public transport. The hotel itself is nice with internet access and is also modern, hotel staff all speak good clear english, they must have taken notice of some of the reviews. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.... only plus point modern decor and free internet...

Reviews.Title: “No Location”
Reviews.Author: fyurday
Reviews.Content: Just a brief information about the Eurostars Roma Congress,I had to book it last minute and used the website lastminute.com it was a top secret 4 star hotel in Rome with a good deal and I said why not but sadly it was a disaster.I can't say the hotel has bad location it has NO location.It is seriously outside of the city no public transport after 11 PM if you are thinking of having a nice night out taxi is the only chance.They do have shuttle bus but 3 in the morning 2 coming back at night you need to plan with their timings.Nearly noone speaks English in the area so I got lost on my way to the hotel after Fuimicino airport and it took 4 hours for me to find my way.I was exhausted on my first day.The area is not good as well.The hotel is also staff is friendly but reception staff is very slow.My check in took 20 minutes.Overall Rome is lovely city to visit but I would pay little more and stay somewhere around Termini train station next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best location”
Reviews.Author: vix85
Reviews.Content: When booking this "4 star hotel" we imagined something totally different to what we was faced with when turning up at the hotel on arrival. To start off with the hotel which we was told was in the centre of Rome was actually in the secluded, grotty outskirts of Rome. Graffiti, closed down shops, rubbish and prostitutes is what this hotel is surrounded by therefore I do not recommend walking around this part of Rome at night or day. The hotel itself was ok but no way up to a 4 star standard. The room itself had a few downsides. We wanted a double bed but were greeted with two hard single beds pushed together which wasn’t so comfy at night due to the split down the middle. The air conditioning was loud at night but due to the heat we had no choice but to leave it on. Every night we had a constant bang outside of our window which now we're still unsure of what it was. Bathroom and shower was nice, even though the shower was a bit on the small side width ways. Also there was no English speaking channels on TV so was hard if your lying in bed and cant sleep (due to very loud air conditioning) thinking TV might help you sleep. We did order room service, was ok but bit pricey, 15 euros for a burger! Even ordering a chocolate gateau was a fuss, first they bought up hot chocolate which we said we didn’t want, and then they bought up tiramisu followed by a white sponge cake. On all these occasions the staff member walked straight into our room. We gave up on room service after that!! Getting to Termini station takes about 20-30 mins by the shuttle bus from the hotel. Times are 8am, 10am and 12pm and then you get picked up either at 7.30pm, 10pm. This cost 4 euros each way per person, not too bad but the drivers are not the friendliest people (I think we got a grunt when we said hello and thank you)!! But I think this is the safest way possible to get to the Termini train station so would recommend this way. The hotel food is ok but not worth what they are charging. You also get free internet access with this hotel but it worked twice in the 5 days we were there!! Overall this hotel was ok but you could find better hotels out there with nicer and safer surroundings. We will not be returning after our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Planning is essential”
Reviews.Author: AditiDubai_U_A_E
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel through the internet at a very reasonable rate. As we researched further, we found the location to be a long distance from the tourist centre, so transport was a majorly worrying issue. Fortunately, the reviews of other members helped us to organise ourselves well in advance. After arrival at Rome, early in the morning , we took the Leonardo Express to Termini Station and left our luggage in the locker, the rate was 3.8 Euros per piece for 5 hours. At the station we booked two tickets on the Hop on and off bus. It took us around the landmarks of Rome for us to start falling in love with the city. Returning to the Termini we collected our luggage and took the Metro to Tiburtina station, from where we took a cab to the hotel, costing us around 22Euros. The check- in process was swift and smooth. We found the hotel room to be spacious and clean but what worried us was the mode of transport to the city centre as cabs were expensive. We booked the hotel return shuttle from the Termini which was 4 Euros per head. On an experiment basis we took a cab outside the hotel to Ponte Mammolo, from where we took the metro to Termini. It felt good being back in the historic city and we continued to explore the city as the Hop on and off tickets were valid for 24 hours. We were back in time to catch the return shuttle to the hotel, the journey took us 20 minutes. The next day we booked the morning shuttle to Termini at 8 in the morning and the return shuttle as well. Once we were within the metro network it was easy commuting and exploring. Walking tour of the Vatican Museum was pre booked through Viator and we reached the meeting point well in time after changing the metro network, line B line A. The Viator tour was excellent ! Next on our list was the Colosseum, Circus Maximus , Roman Forum, Piazza Venezia, Piazza Navona, Parthenon, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Mouth of truth and the many fountains. One can not help but fall in love with the city. It could have been better if the location of our hotel was within the historic centre, but with proper planning , we were able to enjoy the city and its history ; every moment we walked across the ruins and monuments. We look forward to visiting this city again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, dodgy area”
Reviews.Author: AAADawg
Reviews.Content: Seven of us stayed at the Roma Congress in june 2008 and were basically satisfied with our stay. The area around the hotel is an industrial area and there is apparently an Army base across the street. We arrived late on a Thursday evening and there were quite a few women of questionable repute roaming the streets outside the hotel property (The hotel is set off the street and there is a gate that is closed at midnight). This was very unsettling for the family that was traveling with us as they did not see this sort of thing in Texas!!! I tried to explain to them that this was Europe and that attitudes toward this sort of thing were very different, especially in Italy, but I don't think I was very convincing. Other than the location we didn't have any issues with the Hotel. It was serviceable but nothing outstanding. The shuttle bus to Rome worked out very well for us as we drove to Rome and knew better than to try to drive into the town center (we did this on our first trip to rome and paid 60Euro a night to park our car!!!) The only trouble with the bus was that you had to make arrangements for it in the morning and couldn't change your plans. A better option would probably be to use the public transport just outside the hotel property but our friends from Texas would have none of that after seeing the women walking the streets. This hotel is really too far from Rome to be considered for a Roman holiday. For the same price you can get a decent two star hotel in the town center with breakfast. The trip into town takes about 45 minutes and it is impossible to simply leave the hotel at night and wander the streets of the eternal city safely which is one of the things that makes Rome great. If you are driving to Rome, however, the Hotels free parking may make up for the long trip to town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Comfortable Hotel, a little far out, but value for money”
Reviews.Author: saltbran
Reviews.Content: A hotel by the termini was very expensive, so i decided to stay here, compared represent excellent value for money. From leonardo da vinci, it was cheaper/convenient to get to hotel by taxi got a fixed price quote from romeshuttlelimousine.com for 40 euro (excellent service). By train it would cost 11 euro (express train) to termini, then 35 euro to hotel and not many want to go that far out. The hotel is quite far out. There is a shuttle ( 52 seater coach) to the Termini which costs 3 euro each way, that needs to be booked. Leaves 10 or 11 am and returns about 10pm. Be prepared, hotel restaurant is very expensive, no shops are near by at all!. There is a bar about 10 minutes away by bus. Internet access available free in lobby for free, but you have to wait in turn as there is only 1 pc. The room was excellent, very comfortable, clean (as can be seen from photos) and sound proof. The hotel itself was clean. Beds are very comfortable, very spacious, neutral decor. No coffee/tea making facility in room though. Make sure you take travel adaptor. There is a safe in the room, room service is very good. Mini bar also in room. TV channels are not english, so i would recommend you take a laptop and some dvds, for when you get bored. My advice, buy a 7 day travel card 11 euro. There is a bus service to the Metro station (quite frequent), bus stop not too far from hotel on opposite side of road. Metro station into termini was about 10 minutes. From there you have access to everywhere. Overall, i would definately stay there again comapred to other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Modern,clean,value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: jsg0140
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the hotel Eurostars Congress Rome In April 2008. The hotel is very close to the airport (about 10 minutes) and we found a lot of the taxis were not keen to take us and were trying to charge us 60/70 euros.However,we paid 40 euros as I had read on this site that that is the correct rate.When you find out how close you are to the airport you realise this is still daylight robbery!(on the journey back it was only 30 euros on the meter) The hotel really appealed to me as it was modern,clean and quite minimalist,with no chintz,or antiquey style furniture which I hate.Our room was smallish but clean,modern and had everything we needed, and the bathroom was nice with a large power shower. The shuttle bus from the hotel into the city centre leaves at 8.00am and 10.00am (i think!) .The journey was quick;about 25 minutes, and in traffic in the evenings coming back it was still only a maximum of 35 minutes. I would definitely recommend this hotel to other travellers;particulary if you are in Rome for a short city break like we were.The hotel is clean and modern,staff are helpful,attentive and efficient and the shuttle bus is useful and pretty cheap.There is a large supermarket about 10 minutes walk away and the airport is really close.The only annoying thing i found was that the last shuttle bus left Rome at 10.00pm which meant we never got to go out to the late night bars/clubs as a taxi between 2 of us would have been dear but that is my only complaint. As a side note,I found Rome is small and compact in comparison to London and you can walk almost everywhere.The maps make it look really spaced out but from the Termini bus station where the shuttle bus dropped us,we walked to the Colesseum,Trevi Fountain,Spanish steps,Palatine Hill,and the Roman Forum.The Vatican is a little further but walkable if its sunny and you know the right direction;about 30-40 minute walk..If not jump on a bus as its cheap and the Italians were very helpful in telling you where and when to jump off.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: BigDaddy59
Reviews.Content: Nice place, but a bit out of the way. We were here on a tour and we had our own bus, but it did take about 35 - 40 minutes to get into town. The breakfast wasn't much but the hotel was new and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not so staff”
Reviews.Author: IwantoliveinEurope
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as part of a group tour. This was our last hotel of the stay. The rooms were very nice and large. Very modern with FREE wireless access in the lobby. The Italians have a different idea about high speed access than this American however. The hotel lobby is large, but the bar is small. The bartender was rude, slow and unattentive. This with only 3-4 at the bar. The bar prices are extremely high, so bring something with you and keep it in the in-room fridge. The hotel is a trek from the city center of Rome. It was at least a 30 minute drive with our motor coach. I have no idea about local transport into the city. If you are renting a car and have no problem with traffic, this would be a nice choice at a lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Shame about the location”
Reviews.Author: paul611
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a modern glass fronted building. The lobby is spacious with marbled floors and an efficient reception desk (no problem with my limited Italian). Our room was spacious and well furnished featuring a modern bathroom (large shower, but no bath) comfortable beds and a TV with at least one news channel in English. The room was spotless and this was maintained throughout our stay. All this at a bargain price ... there must be a snag. It was our first visit to Rome. From Terminii Station an Eu 16 taxi ride took us to the hotel. Not wanting to bankrupt ourselves we ruled out taxis thereafter. The hotel does offer a Eur 4 (each way) coach to the centre of Rome, but we opted for a Eur 4 day pass for bus and metro. The journey each way took the best part of an hour. The hotel says it is situated in a business area, I would describe it more as an industrial estate, no chance of a romantic evening stroll. All this having been said the hotel is just off the autostrada and for anyone touring Italy by car and wanting a hotel where they could park up for a couple of days it could be an option. Would I stay there again? Probably not, although the rate and the service were excellent, vacation time is too precios to squander on travel to and from the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Dimas-Indonesia
Reviews.Content: We are a couple from Indonesia who traveled to Italy for vacations. We stayed at Eurostars Roma Congress Hotel. We booked it from Ryanair's website because it offered the best price with the best looked pictures of its rooms. And, it offered shuttle bus to center Rome. What we got was a very "cool" hotel with its understaffed service. We had to pay 40 euros for the taxi only to reach the hotel from Roma Ciampino airport otherwise we could not go to the hotel. I asked them about the transportation to the hotel from the airport but there was no reply at all from them so we had to take taxi. After we arrived, there was no problem with the check-in but there was one with my room door. The electronic key could not open it. I went to the receptionist to complain it and he gave me another one. Still, it didn't work. Finally, he gave me the regular key and promised to fix the problem in the next day but it didn't happen. In the second day, we had a problem with the shuttle bus service. We already had booked for such service one night before and the receptionist told me to come to the receptionist again tomorrow before departure for the bus ticket. We booked for the 12.00 bus and he told me to come downstairs at 11.45. What happened was astonishing. I looked a very long queue of people for checking-out and were serviced only by one hotel staff. I had to stand in the line as well just for the ticket. I started to queue at 11.40 and until 12.10 I still could not able to have the tickets. I lost my patience and went forward to the staff to ask about my problem. He said calmly, "Oh, the bus already left Sir." Then I got furious and he replied "Sorry Sir, you have to wait in the line". I could not stand it anymore. Then we managed to find our own way to the center of Rome by public transport which cost us cheaper than we took the shuttle but takes longer time, about 1 our to the center. Then, when we checked-out, the hotel billed me for the booked shuttle service. I complained and the staff told me that I cant complain because I already booked it. I got furious again and finally talked to the manager and she managed it and said sorry to us. Overall, this is a brand new hotel with brand new management as well. All rooms are well-furnished. Very modern style with good private bathrooms and toilets. It could be better if they can provide water cooker in the rooms. However, for for us, the value for money of this hotel is not OK at all. Although it's cheap, it's too far from the city center and if you want to take the shuttle, you have to pay 4 euro each person for one way only. Return = 8 euro each. And, for the cheap price, you don't get breakfast. For breakfast, we had to pay 16 euro each.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldnt stay again”
Reviews.Author: Tweety01
Reviews.Content: We came here for our honeymoon on a budget because it looked beautiful. We were disapointed. We had booked room only and wanted to order breakfast for the first morning to come to our room. We did this using a card which you hang on the door. We ordered 1 of the cheapest at i think 8euros. When it came, they said there had been a misprint on the card and it was actually 24euros and they brought us 2 instead of the 1 asked for (we were going to share) and refused to take one back! so that was a pricey start! We decided to use their shuttle bus service to get into rome. This was a good hour each way. This was also disapointing since we were led to believe the hotel was in the centre of rome. Hotel was clean and tidy and comfortable. nice rooms. rubbish service. horrible overpriced food. too far away from rome. Dont go here if you want to see the sights of rome!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: anneharper1951
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights attending a conference held there. About twenty five of us arrived about midnight still needing to check in. The person trying to check us in had great difficulty with the computer so that we (and we were near the beginning of the line) didn't get into our room until about 1 am. The room was small, the bed extremely hard and uncomfortable, and there was minimal lighting. The biggest problem was the heating. There was no way to shut it off since it is centrally controlled. We had the window open 100% of the time (and so did everyone else). The shower in the bathroom was so small that I had to squeeze myself in and out of it with some discomfort. The conference food was terrible. My husband and I didn't eat it several times. Lunches and dinners were served in three courses: pasta, meat and dessert. No salads and a vegetable only once. Potatoes twice. Rolls were on the table as were still and effervescent mineral water. The waiters and waitresses came to the tables with platters and served us from those platters which took a long time for our group of about 110. The pasta was certainly not up to Italian standards and often cold. The meat was skimpy, and one day the pork they served was not fully cooked: it was a dark pink. The breakfast buffet was not up to par either. It did included scrambled eggs, however, they were powdered and not fresh eggs. The breads served were somewhat stale. On the plus side, for celiacs (those with gluten allergies), they did offer several gluten-free packaged pastries. I'm not a celiac, but I have a daughter who is (but she wasn't with us). This hotel is quite a distance from the center of Rome, so I would not recommend it for sightseers. The hotel does have a free shuttle into the city, but we didn't use it. There was only one computer in the lobby for hotel guests to use so there was sometimes a line. We stayed at the hotel one night beyond the conference and ate in its restaurant. The Caesar salad was made up primarily of sliced chicken breast and parmigiana cheese. What little lettuce there was came from the very inside of the lettuce and was bitter. The beef I ordered was heavily marinated so that it was difficult to tell it was even beef. The restaurant was very overpriced and a huge disappointment. We had been told there was an ATM on the premises, but when I checked I was told it was "five minutes walk" away. At the end of our time, we had the hotel arrange for transportation to our hotel near the Vatican. It cost a whopping 40 Euros. We would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Way too far away from Rome for such rude service...”
Reviews.Author: lkkaela
Reviews.Content: Rome was our last stop after visiting Venice, Florence, Sienna and San Gimignano. Unfortunately, it was totally stressful - made only by the hotel. A half hour commute took us close to 4 hours from Termini. First of all, the Tourist Information desk at the Termini station gave us the wrong directions sending us to the nearest Tram and told us to get off at the 10th stop on Prenestina and walk up 100 meters to the hotel - wrong!! The 10th stop was on the 200th block of the street; Eurostar hotel is located at 944 Prenestina. As we walked the addresses progressed 200, 201, 202, 203, etc - you get the picture. In addition to having to lug our luggage - it was quite warm out. The locals we asked for directions were not helpful at all - they just pointed down the street. Plus, the hotel posts signs along Prenestina around the 300 block pointing to their hotel, leaving you with the impression that they were just around the corner! Extremely long story short and several trams and buses later - we finally made it to the hotel and were greeted by a cold unfriendly uncaring staff. They could have cared less at how long it took us to get there. Unfortunately, their attitude carried on for the remainder of our 4 day stay. God forbid they lift a finger to help or even express a word of gratitude. The hotel room was clean and modern enough, but their rude attitude did not deserve our business. I would not recommend this hotel to first time visitors to Rome; way too far from Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel.”
Reviews.Author: adele13
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Eurostars Roma Congress hotel for for 6 nights in June 2007. I went with my Sister and Nephew. We went to Rome to join my Mum and her husband who had had their holiday booked 9 months in advance, they were flying on the Saturday for 7 nights. Me and my Sister decided on the Thursday that we would get a last minute flight on the Sunday morning and spend 6 nights with them. As we had decided to go last minute we didnt have a huge budget just enough for the flight, hotel, food and to see all the attractions. We searched for a hotel in our budget but as we were last minute most central hotels were fully booked and because of this we had to look futher out of the city centre. This led us to Eurostars Roma Congress . When my sister told me the distance from the hotel to central Rome I was a bit shocked as we had worked out it was about 8 miles and thought it may spoil our trip, but we were lucky that all of us had chipped in to get a rented car for the 6 days and so driving to and from the hotel to central Rome was not a problem (although we got lost almost every night going to the hotel), though if you were planning to stay in this hotel and see all Rome attractions without a hire car I would not advise it, cos it would mean paying 35 euros for a taxi (one way) or getting on the shuttle bus everyday but there are only 2 in the morning into Rome and one at about 8 at night back to the hotel (which makes your days very limited). Apart from the distance and travelling into Rome centre, the hotel is fab!!!! It was so modern and clean. The reception area was huge and tidy and as it wasnt in the centre it wasnt to busy with tourist and was mostly used for business people who were there for conferences. The room was big and beds comfy and the bathroom was immaculate and roomy. All the towels were changed everyday and when we came in each night the room was tidy and not once were we bothered and everything from check in/ out to paying went smoothly. The only thing was that we didnt have bed and breakfast and a couple of days we had breakfast but it was dear at about 17 euros. I used the free internet access every night (in the lobby area) which was great to keep in touch with my partner, which was an excellent facility provided by the hotel (internet access in available in the room but at a charge). I would highly recommend this hotel for comfort and price but if you want to go to Rome to see the sights and fill your days with sightseeing then I would suggest getting a hotel closer to the centre. I loved Rome so much I am taking my partner there this year for Christmas as it is such a romantic place and I cannot wait to spend my first christmas abroad in the eternal city with my Love.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: iam5tv
Reviews.Content: As a hotel, this is a really nice place to stay. The restaurant serves good food (around £15 average price per dish), they have a computer to use the internet for free, and the rooms were exactly as I expected from the website. They have a shuttle bus which you can book from the front counter which drops you off right outside Roma Termini station - this is the Hotel's biggest attaction for me. As I couldn't find it on any websites, the price for it is €4 per person each way. For a couple going to Rome for the day, €16 is pretty good. It takes about 30 minutes to get there. The instructions for getting to the Hotel using public transport were a bit confusing, and getting the train to the nearest station for the bus is much harder than it seems - they are very far apart, not even one train per hour! My advice would be to use the shuttle bus, or otherwise get to Tiburtina station and jump in a taxi (taxi ride is about €15). The other annoying thing is that this hotel has a policy of not letting the guests use an iron in their room - forcing you to use their expensive ironing service. Overall I would recommend this hotel as a place to stay, even for sightseeing in Rome. The location is the only real let-down and there are many workarounds, so no problem really!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Explores
Reviews.Content: Couple with 6 years old son. Hotel is indeed badly situated, but I agree you should do your home work before travelling. We knew about that and were prepared for the long drive which indeed was long but I can not blame the hotel for that. The Hotel itself was ok. Our room was spacious, clean and airy. The bathroom a little on the small side with only a tiny shower, not very confy but clean though. Breakfast was good, actually one of the best we had in Italy, I would disagree with some other guests that said otherwise. It had a good variety and it was always well served. We did have a little problem with the air com that was not working properly and it caused some headache. Room service was dreadful and when asked for extra pillows, it took then 2 hours to deliver, time in which we were all a sleep. Next day we asked for some more toilet paper and soap as they did not restock earlier and by the time they arrived, myself, my husband and my son have had showers (we did not have showers together) and My husband had already made a point that he had asked for it over an hour before the first of us went for the shower. Anyway, good value hotel but nothing out of the ordinary including the problems and small headaches. I would not recommend but I would not throw stones either. Still was value for money considering Italy, where even if you pay £400 a night still below expectation so you might as well pay less and suffer the consequences as they may be the same as when paying 3 times the amount.

Reviews.Title: “More than 10km from the city centre!”
Reviews.Author: caz126
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a "mystery hotel" (for 3 nights stay)given that it was cheap. A word of advice: Don't bother booking mystery hotels because you can't read the reviews beforehand! The main complaint is the distance from the city centre. It was definitely more than 10km if the taxi driver took 35-40 mins to drive from Termini station to the hotel in non peak traffic conditions. The shuttle service to and fro the hotel to the city centre was opearting at ODD times being 8:30am, 11:00am leaving the hotel and 6:00pm and 10:30pm leaving the city centre. What happens if you wanted to leave the city centre at 8:30pm or 9pm after dinner? Well you simply can't, you had to wait for 10:30pm to roll by. I would gladly have paid extra money to stay closer to the hotel given all the taxi fares we spent. After a 5 hour discussion with hotel reception staff to change to another affliated hotel, staff were incredibily unhelpful and indifferent to our situation. We asked to use the phone to call the London agent to try to change hotels (using the reception phone) and only AFTER the call was made, hotel staff asked us to pay for the 35 euro call. We bought food from the super market and requested a plate and 2 forks and they wanted to charge us 5 euros for that. There were no basic coffee/tea making facilities. What is the point of feed back forms displayed in the hotel reception when they took away the clear plastic box that contained all the feedback (the day we left the hotel)??? Save yourself the trouble and don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but just too far from centre”
Reviews.Author: natandgrant
Reviews.Content: Prior to booking I read the reviews for this hotel, and although I was concerned by the distance from central Rome I decided to give this hotel a go, as I am not phased by a bit of public transport and sometimes you get more of the essence of a place by mixing with the locals. We arrived after a great flight and grabbed a cab outside the airport with no probs. I had heard cabs were pricey so made sure to check cab was metered. We headed off and in about 10mins were outside the hotel, all smiles until I asked how much the cab fare was, to be told "sorry meter is broken, but price will be sixty euros" To which I said "You are having a laugh" or something to that affect as I am certainly no fool and can blag best price as good as the next man. Words ensued and surprise surprise the gentleman was suddenly struggling with his English. So I went into the hotel and got reception to translate. I finally agreed fourty euros much to my disgust. We were room only basis at the hotel which I couldn't fault for the price, room was lovely albeit our view was of a wall, who goes to rome to spend their time in the hotel. We freshened up and headed off into town, reception advised us to get the bus at the bottom of the road as by 1100hrs we had missed the shuttle bus. We headed off down the road to the bus stop which is a good 5-10mins walk. Buses run quite regular but the journey takes at least 20mins to bus station where you then have to get a tube which takes a further 15mins to the terminal....... from where you take an additional journey to whichever attraction you are going to see. Totalling that up the trip could be a minimum of fourty five minutes. Not to forget that even in May weather in Rome is warm and public transport is overcrowded to say the least. We loved Rome as there was loads to see and it is a truely beautiful city, but I just found that the constant travelling back and forth from the hotel grappling for breathing space with the locals just took some of the romance out of it and made a packed three days more tiring than it should have been. The money we saved on the hotel was almost spent entirely on the two airport transfers. We had only one late night as we couldn't afford the taxi fares, which were slightly cheaper from town at 25 euros. The vatican city is a must, we missed out on the Sistine Chapel as it closes at 1530hrs and by 1000hrs the que was a no go, advice post our visit is get there by half seven at the latest. Although I sound like I am moaning we had a great time, just think by staying this far away from the centre caused us un necessary stress. Go to Rome have a great time, but spend a bit more on staying central.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: DUSKWICK
Reviews.Content: Ignore anyone who rubishes this hotel. it may be further out from the city, but they provide a shuttle bus service twice in the morning and pick you up from the centre twice at night. the hotel itself is lovely and the staff are extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice because it's new”
Reviews.Author: gr82travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we were driving through Italy and wanted to avoid driving into the city centre. The shuttle service they offered was well worth it, a 30-35 minute trip each way which really didn't seem that long. The shuttle was actually a coach bus which may have resolved the problems earlier travellers had. We had to reserve a spot and present a slip. If you are looking for friendly staff, don't stay here. Indifferent was more like it but if you are ok with service without a smile, the rest is not bad. I was not impressed with the breakfast buffet, I would not pay for it if it is not included in your room rate. The eggs were gross! The rooms were the best part, nicely set up with a keyboard connected to the tv that could give you internet access right there and like I said, everything still has a newness about it. The location in the city is not attractive, it seems like an unusual place for a hotel, though I did not feel unsafe and there was a nice little mall with a supermarket where we spent almost two hours deciphering the food choices. You would be much better off picking up something to eat here! Try the blood oranges...and the hard rolls were great! It is true that the showers cycle hot and cold water, you would think a newer hotel would not have that problem!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic & Cheap 4 Star Hotel If You Plan For Location Issue...”
Reviews.Author: StevenParky
Reviews.Content: In Summary... Hotel Quality **** Location * Value For Money ***** We arrived at Ciampino after some really cheap flights from Nottingham East Midlands. I went over to a taxi driver who said it would be €55 for the journey! OUCH - there goes the cheap flights? It was actually a lot better for us to take a "terravision" bus from the airport (for ryanair and easyjet passengers only - €8 each) to the Termini (train station) in central Rome. At the station we left our luggage for 6 hours (costing €3.60 per item). During this time we were able to make the most of the time we had and started exploring! I used my mobile to call the friendly reception desk who said that the hotel shuttle bus left from VIA MASALA in between building numbers 7 and 9 (this is a small bus park on the edge of the street for about 8 buses). We thought this would be free as it did state in our details it was, however it was €4 per person per way. Note: the bus leaves the hotel at 0830 and 1100 and returns from VIA MASALA at 1800 and 2230. This proved a much cheaper way of getting to the hotel rather than taxi. However - the hotel have a black mercedes service for the way back costing €50 (we had no option than to get this because of our flight time)! People have had some bad experiences with this hotel and I kind of thought twive about booking it. I took the gamble and it was excellent, upgraded to superior at no extra charge! If you plan ahead - you will win. Those who mentioned the poor, slow reception service - isn't that just the Italian way? Steven Parkinson (York)

Reviews.Title: “Too far out for me personally”
Reviews.Author: laura777
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 18th March -22nd March . Arrived at Ciampino airport and had a "discussion" with the taxi drivers as to the cost to the hotel , they started at 60 euros but we managed to get them down to 40 euros , which is still scandalous bearing in mind the distance , the taxi on return was only 25 euros . Check in staff efficient and we got our room straight away even though its was only 11 30 am . The room was spacious with king size bed good size tv but as usual the only english channels were CNN and BBC world news ..Room was spotless but the shower had a lot to be desired , it looked great but varied between freezing cold and scalding hot (not the best ) . I had read reviews about money being taken from the room so didn't risk the safe . On our day of arrival had missed the shuttle bus so made our way into Rome via bus and metro which is easily doable . The hotel is situated in a quiet area but there is a small shopping mall not 5 minutes walk from the hotel with a large Carrefours supermarket there . Didn't have breakfast but tried the bar food one night which I have to say was pretty bad. We personally would not stay at this hotel again becuse of the location , it's too far from Rome ,1 night it took an hour to return to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: joebatafuco
Reviews.Content: This hotel was horrendus. I experienced problems after problems. My property was stolen from my room. Once reporting it to the hotel managers, I was lied to several times that the matter was being dealt with.One of the managers, Mario, lied to us on several occasions. Also, my Hotel room door was left open after the maid had serviced the room. The staff were very unhelpful and did not help out at all. Also, 100 yards up the road from the hotel is a prostitute district, they operate in the day and in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, even if the location isn't”
Reviews.Author: sherpajacob
Reviews.Content: have just returned from weekend in Rome with my wife to watch wales v italy rugby match. The Hotel itself is excellent. Spacious lobby, rooms very clean and comfortable, bathrooms excellent.. Staff very frienldy and all spoke English. What is the problem americans have with staff who don't speak english. YOU ARE IN ITALY they speak Italian. We had room only and paid 16 euros each for breakfast, But the breakfast was outstanding, we didn't need to eat again till the evening. Tho only drawback, You guessed it, The Location. It is a little way out, but it is not in the middle of nowhere, it is on one of the main roads out of rome. We paid between 15 euros and 30 euros in metered taxis., depending on traffic from hotel to Termini station. Takes between 15 and 45mins, depending on traffic, but all of rome is like that. From termini station there are unlicensed taxis who you can haggle with. We paid no more than 20 euros late at night to get back to hotel. On saturday we used public transport from hotel,;bus then metro, whole journey cost only 1 euro each, and was a good way to meet some colourful locals. Wouldn't recommned this late at night.
