Hotel shuttle bus was also useful 4 euros each way to Termini, although i think they could run more services, particularly later at night, with a smaller minibus. Overall a very relaxing and comforatble hotel to come back to at the end of a long day.

Reviews.Title: “amazing price for what you get..”
Reviews.Author: glasgowgirl2007
Reviews.Content: We had a car so the distance to/from city centre wasn't too big a problem, hotel room was lovely..restaurant was very nice. Check-in staff were very good although busy, spoke english very well. I was a bit iffy after reading reviews some good some bad, but this hotel definetly is worth it if you have a car...

Reviews.Title: “We loved this as it was a break from the fast paced city”
Reviews.Author: eosfmk
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Eurostars Roma Congress recently, after travelling from Naples. It was a relief and a pleasure to arrive at this hotel after Naples. The staff were noting but helpful and friendly at all times. Our room was spacious and had all the facalities they had listed on their website. the only downfall with our room was that we were overlooking the glass roof of what we presume was a conference/function room, which left us with no view or daylight. But to be fair we were not in rome for the view!! the breakfast was fantastic. we had a choice of every food imaginable!! What we didn't like was having to stand in a queue outside the breakfast room until a table became available, but the breakfast and the staff more than made up for this. We were aware how far out the hotel was but the shuttle bus was the deciding factor with us when we booked this hotel. Our real problem was the bus schedule at night time (last bus was at 9/10pm) but we luckily got an honest cab driver! Problem solved!! I will definatley rate this hotel and i will be returning again

Reviews.Title: “don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: weefee75
Reviews.Content: If you are in Rome to do the traditional tourist thing - Coliseum, Patheneon, eateries etc - DO NOT go to the hotel. It is too far away from the city centre and the time that we went there was also a taxi strike which frequently happens we were told. This meant we were totally reliable on the shuttle bus that takes you to and from the city centre - takes about 20 mins. Your whole day was centered around when the bus left the hotel and city. At night the last bus was 10pm so there was no chance to experience the nightlife of Rome. One time we ran for the 9pm bus (there are about 4 a day each way) and it was full so we had to wait for the next one. What would have happened if that was full? I am so surprised that Last minute are advertising this hotel. It's perfect for business but just SO unsuitable for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Another miserable experience with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Genn
Reviews.Content: I hope that our review will help somebody to avoid any problem at this hotel It happend at the beginning of the August. Our group arrived to this hotel an it took a rather long time to get a room. We received a room with air-conditioner out of order and had to struggle for about 2 hours in order to change it because of inexpereinced and hardly English speaking receptionists team who finds difficult any simple question and pay no attention on the customers When we entered our new room after such struggle we found some used things of previous customer so the chambermaid team is rather lazy The next day was marked by 100 euro banknote disappeared from locked (by my private code) room safe I wrote down our explanations to the hotel manager but nobody contacted me for 3 weeks I sent several E-mails to the hotel manager Mr Claudio - no answer, telephone call & fax - no answer Wonderful! What a nice hotel! You are welcome! I can't recommend this hotel to somebody and I would like to prevent tourists from it I tried to find telephone numbers and E-mail addresses of the Executives of the "Eurostars hotels" chain but failed It would be very interesting to ask them some questions

Reviews.Title: “Excellent -”
Reviews.Author: Dinocas
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel in rome for one night upon our arrival, since we would be leaving for tuscany the next day. It was excellent: easy access - GRA16, excellent lobby, rooms, buffet breakfast, cleanliness, etc.. we arrived at Vatican City in about 20 mins, by car, so it really isn't that far away. (We prefer hotels away from the city centre). the staff was very nice and when we asked for two extra pillows, they arrived at our door in about 2 minutes! would definately stay here next time in Rome. P.S. while travelling through Tuscany, we had the oportunity to stay at another Eurostars Hotel, this time in Lucca. Again, it was great. Stongly reccommend Eurostars Hotel Chain.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel for money”
Reviews.Author: joanna070768
Reviews.Content: Eurostars Roma Congress Hotel is about 8 miles from Rome but provides a quiet back drop to a very hectic city. The hotel provides an air conditioned courtesy bus to Rome several times each day and as long as you bear this in mind and do not mind the travelling you'll enjoy your stay. Queueing for the bus does not apply in Italy, be prepared to trample to get on it...two buses were provided for the morning trip at 11am as there were too many people all trying to get on one 52 seater. The hotel itself was beautiful, very clean, fantastic breakfast and lovely helpful staff who spoke very good English. It is in the middle of nowhere but in some ways its nice to leave the city after a long day and get some peace. The costs were minimal considering the standard of hotel, but this may be due to it being further out than most hotels. Visit this hotel with the mindset that you are outside of Rome and will have to use their courtesy bus daily and you'll enjoy every moment of your stay. The airport taxi drivers are a bit scary but we got to the hotel without too much haggling and costing 50 Euros.

HotelInfo.Name: Eurostars Roma Congress
HotelInfo.Address: Via Prenestina, 944, 00155 Rome, Italy
